attributes.action: A United Kingdom meaningful vote of No confidence in our government
attributes.additional_details: The current selection of MPs have totally abandoned the fundamental process of democracy that once made this Country great. Enough is enough, you have embarrassed the people to breaking point, you have all failed in your basic jobs of representation putting your own egos ahead of morals, its time to go. The people of the UK were asked to make a decision on remain or leave the EU with the promise that what ever the result was it would be carried out.
attributes.background: The current situation regarding the way in which the whole Brexit negotiations and debates have gone over the last two and a half years is northing short of an absolute disgrace.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for a vote of no confidence.

We used to accept petitions that called for a vote of no confidence. However, the Petitions Committee can’t schedule votes of no confidence. This was often frustrating and disappointing for petitioners. 

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that. 
Petitions calling for action on policy are more likely to be an effective way of achieving the change you want.
